body.body: Evaporative Emmisions Control System - Engine Off

When the engine is stationary any pressure increase in the fuel tank due to a rise in ambient temperature will cause the fuel vapour to pass down the breather pipe A to a carbon filled canister which stores the vapour.
Once in the carbon canister, vapour cannot return to the fuel tank because of a one way valve in the carbon canister.

title: Evaporative Emmisions Control System - Engine Off
